page.title: 09CORBY'S SWIMMING BATHS.
page.content: The baths were opened in 1968. The amount of water in the pool is 2030 gallons. Average attendance is 300 daily, and about 40 disabled people use the baths. About 30 galas are held each year. Attendance has not been affected by the recent opening of Kettering baths The manager said that 85% of users were children. Swimming was a fun activity, only 15% doing it for fitness. It is an increasingly popular activity, though adults stop coming in the winter. Adults pay 60p for admission, juniors 35p, with no free entry for the unemployed. 2-3 attendants are always on duty, and had to rescue only 6-7 per year. Video scanners had reduced vandalism. The snack bar, which used to be manned by staff, now offers drinks and snacks from vending machines. It is very popular.
